feed.title: Brackets Extensions Weekly
feed.subtitle: New and updated stuff to improve your Brackets experience

entry.title: Weekly Brackets Extension Update - 15/16
entry.content:
Welcome to This Week’s Brackets Extension Updates, Issue 15/16.

Added or updated @Brackets extensions in the week from 04/05/2015 to 04/12/2015.

Last week there were 8 new Extensions and 3 updates. This includes themes and other extensions.

What’s going on?

I’m late, late, late and still catching up with the previous weeks. Too much things going on at the same time. :-)

Have a great week!

In the meantime, you can find us on these social networks

  • Facebook
  • Google Plus
  • twitter

Share your thoughts and stories, ask questions and get in touch with the team.

As usual, you can download the latest Brackets release. Please let us know what you think.

Top 11 Extension Downloads of last week

Find an overview of extensions that moved up and down the list.

Rank # Name Downloads Previous Week
1 Emmet 12514 #3 ⇑
2 Code Folding 6638 #5 ⇑
3 Brackets Git 6092 #1 ⇓
4 Beautify 3914 #2 ⇓
5 Minimap 2388 #7 ⇑
6 HTML Skeleton 2363 ☼
7 Interactive Linter 1739 ☼
8 Todo 1653 ☼
9 Themes for Brackets 1652 ☼
10 Brackets Icons 1534 ☼
11 QuickDocsJS 1216 ☼

Top 11 Theme Downloads of last week

Find an overview of themes that moved up and down the list.

Rank # Name Downloads Previous Week
1 Monokai Dark Soda 1205 #2 ⇑
2 DarkSoda 936 ☼
3 Flat Attack 856 ☼
4 Spacegray-Brackets 848 ☼
5 Speed Material Dark Theme 819 ☼
6 Flatness 813 ☼
7 Base 16 - Ocean Dark 522 ☼
8 Monokai 519 #6 ⇓
9 Unity 438 ☼
10 Flat Attack 420 ☼
11 Stripper (Clean UI Redo) 291 ☼

New Extensions

Name Version Description Download
Speed Material Dark Theme 1.0.0 A dark theme (based on Quick Dark) who use material colors
Flat Attack 1.0.0 Flat color light theme for Brackets.
Stripper (Clean UI Redo) 0.1.1 A brackets theme focused on readabilty. Based on the theme made by visualbam - https://github.com/visualbam/Brackets-Stripper

Updated Extensions

Name Version Description Download
Todo 0.8.1 Display all TODO comments in current document or project.
Emmet 1.2.2 High-speed HTML and CSS workflow
Stylus Extension for Brackets 1.1.1 A basic stylus extension for Brackets
EditorConfig 0.0.4 Supporting EditorConfig features
Brackets Print Margin 0.3.0 Adds a print margin line to the editor to helpt you keep your lines of code below a certain length. Easy configuration in the status bar.
Spacegray-Brackets 1.1.0 The popular Spacegray theme from Sublime Text, now in Brackets!
Minimap 3.2.4 The minimap shows a smaller version of your code at the right of the screen. It can be used to quickly scroll to a certain part of your file. This is a fork of brackets-wdminimap by Brian Adams (https://github.com/websiteduck/brackets-wdminimap)
Flatness 1.0.3 Flatness is a Brackets theme based on Designmodo’s flat ui colours

Neon 1.1.5 Neon theme for Brackets. Themed Code Folding and CSS Color Preview.

Show Recently Used Items 0.5.1 Add a menu at the top of the editor with a list of all the files shown recently

entry.title: Weekly Brackets Extension Update - 15/10
entry.content:
Welcome to This Week’s Brackets Extension Updates, Issue 15/10.

Added or updated @Brackets extensions in the week from 02/23/2015 to 03/01/2015.

Last week there were 7 new Extensions and 15 updates. This includes themes and other extensions.

What’s going on?

I’m a bit late this time. Too much things going on at the same time. :-)
We are in the final stages before the Brackets 1.3 release. Some final touches and some polish before we can call it ready. So plase stay tuned and get slowly into excitement about the new release. As usual, we’d like to hear your feedback.

Have a great week!

In the meantime, you can find us on these social networks

  • Facebook
  • Google Plus
  • twitter

Share your thoughts and stories, ask questions and get in touch with the team.

As usual, you can download the latest Brackets release. Please let us know what you think.

New Extensions

Name Version Description Download
Fira in Brackets 1.0.0 A simple extension that changes the Brackets UI fonts to Fira Mono and Fira Sans.
No Fade in Split View 0.0.1 Disable fading of inactive window in split view.
C++/Objective-C Pack 1.0.0 Enhancements for Brackets when working with C, C++, Objective-C or Objective-C++ — Objective-C/C++ syntax highlighting, Ctrl-T (Quick Find Definition) for navigating a file, Ctrl-J (Jump to Definition) on #include jumps to included file, Ctrl-Shift-J anywhere toggles between header and main src file.
DS Tools 0.0.4 DS Specific tools for brackets
Dracula 1.0.0 Improved Dracula theme
Quick Insert 1.0.0 One key shortcut to insert text/tag/url
Geeko Water 0.1.0 Tema basado en la guía de estilo de Peter Gabriel’s Debut Album en TheDaysColor, con un toque Geeko.

Updated Extensions

Name Version Description Download
Indent Guides 1.3.3 Show indent guides in the code editor.
Column Ruler 2.3.9 An adjustable column ruler for Brackets.
Lines of Code Counter for JavaScript 1.2.0 Counts the number of JavaScript files, lines, and lines of code (“SLOC” - excluding whitespace/comments) in your project. Supports exclusions. To get started, choose “View > Count Lines of Code”.
Lint ALL the Things 1.1.1 Lint everything in your project in one batch! Optionally filter out certain files or folders, and see all the rest in a consolidated report. To get started, choose “View > Lint Whole Project”.
VisibleTabs 0.0.3 Make tabs visible in CodeMirror
Extensions Toolbar Reposition 0.2.9 Move extension toolbar to bottom to enlarge editor window. Hide and manage extension icons.
Go-IDE 0.0.10 Go language IDE transformation for brackets (needs gocode)
Projects 0.1.6 Open your projects from handy modal dialog. Really helpful if you have a lot of projects.
Zurb Foundation 5 Basic Template 1.0.2 Adds Zurb Foundation 5 basic template to your page. Go to menu and select File -> New Zurb Foundation 5 Document.
Tabs - Custom Working 4.0.1 Adds toolbar it include buttons show/hide with tabs of active documents on the top of the editor.

ToggleCase 0.1.2 Toggle the case of the current word
Stripper 0.1.0 A brackets theme focused on readabiity.

What’s going on?

I’m a bit late this time. Too much things going pon at the same time. :-)
We are in the final stages before the Brackets 1.3 release. Some final touches and some polish before we can call it ready. So plase stay tuned and get slowly into excitement about the new release. As usual, we’d like to hear your feedback.

entry.title: Weekly Brackets Extension Update - 15/01
entry.content:
Welcome to This Week’s Brackets Extension Updates, Issue 15/01.

Added or updated @Brackets extensions in the week from 12/22/2014 to 12/29/2014.

This week there were 4 new Extensions and 22 updates. This includes themes and other extensions.

Some closing words for 2014

Pretty low traffic this week. Everybody seems to enjoy their holiday break.

Anyway, I’d like to share so data and thoughts. This is my personal opinion and doesn’t necessarily reflect my employers opinion.

This was an awesome year for Brackets and the whole ecosystem around it. Since the first edition of the Weekly Brackets Extension Update on 05/26/2014, the number of extension Authors went up to 371 from 188. The number of extensions grew up to 616 from 311 by the end of 2014!
I think this is pretty amazing and it is something to celebrate at the end of a great year.

I think, we all have some good ideas for new extensions. Or ideas how we can improve existing ones to make Brackets the best solution for web developer. We have something for designer and coder alike. Let’s spread the word and make it better.

You can find us on these social networks

  • Facebook
  • Google Plus
  • twitter

Share your thoughts and stories, ask questions and get in touch with the team.

As usual, you can download the latest Brackets release. Please let us know what you think.

entry.title: Weekly Brackets Extension Update - 14/52
entry.content:
Welcome to This Week’s Brackets Extension Updates, Issue 14/52.

Added or updated @Brackets extensions in the week from 12/15/2014 to 12/22/2014.

This week there were 4 new Extensions and 23 updates. This includes themes and other extensions.

What’s going on

Yeah, we finally released Brackets 1.1! With the help of our great community, we were able to release Brackets before the christmas break. Have a look at the blog post that provides detailed information about the release.

For now, we are going to prepare for the 1.3 release end of January 2015. But until we get back to work around 1/5/2015, we will participate in the holiday shutdown here at Adobe. Things will slow down a bit. Let’s take some rest and look back at an awesome year for Brackets.
Hope to see everyone back beginning of next year. Refreshed, energetic and ready to make Brackets the best tool webdev’s have seen so far.

As usual, you can download the latest Brackets release and let us know what you think.
Have a great week and happy holidays!

entry.title: Weekly Brackets Extension Update - 14/51
entry.content:
Welcome to This Week’s Brackets Extension Updates, Issue 14/51.

Added or updated @Brackets extensions in the week from 12/08/2014 to 12/15/2014.

This week there were 4 new Extensions and 16 updates. This includes themes and other extensions.

What’s going on

We are close to the end of 2014. Only 2 weeks left and it was an exciting year. Brackets gained a lot of traction and sparked interest in a lot of directions. Brackets grew a lot in the past 12 months. We have a big community behind brackets, a lot of active contributor and people like you, who contribute to Brackets with a bug report, a theme or with a great extension that fills a gap. Thank you!. Brackets is successful, because of your continued contributions and support. Let’s keep this going in 2015.

The Brackets team is finalising the 1.1 Release. It will be available mid of this week. So keep an eye on your update notification icon.
This will be the last release for 2014. The team will take a break from an event packed year. Some of us might be available during the christmas break, but expect lower traffic on commits and less reviewed pull request until next year.

Let’s keep our fingers crossed and wait for the 1.1 release of Brackets this week. If you can’t wait until then, you can still download the latest Brackets release and let us know what you think.
Have a great week!

entry.title: Weekly Brackets Extension Update - 14/50
entry.content:
Welcome to This Week’s Brackets Extension Updates, Issue 14/50.

Added or updated @Brackets in the week from 12/01/2014 to 12/08/2014.

This week there were 2 new Extensions and 11 updates. This includes themes and other extensions.

What’s going on

The Brackets team is still eagerly working on the 1.1 Release. We have fixed most of the CEF issues. There is still some love for the Linux version required. It seems that we are not releasing the Linux version with the new CEF version. This is unfortunate, but you will get all the other bugfixes and improvements, except the new brackets shell. We continue to work on resolving all the outstanding issues with CEF and Linux, and hope to release it with 1.3 beginning of next year.

So, we will have some exciting times ahead. Only a handful of days before we call out the new release. In the meantime, pleae stay tuned and get the latest Brackets build and let us know what you think.
Thanks!

entry.title: Weekly Brackets Extension Update - 14/49
entry.content:
Welcome to This Week’s Brackets Extension Updates, Issue 14/49.

Added or updated @Brackets in the week from 11/24/2014 to 12/01/2014.

This week there were 6 new Extensions and 18 updates. This includes themes and other extensions.

What’s going on

The Brackets team is eagerly working on the 1.1 Release. We are currently reviewing a lot of open pull requests to get as many into the new release as possible. We are also working on getting CEF version 2171 integrated into Brackets. This is a huge step forward for Brackets. The current CEF version uses Chrome 29, whereas the new CEF version will give us Chrome 39! This means bugfixes, a lot of improvements and especially new DevTools.

So, we will have some exciting times ahead of us before we call out the new release. In the meantime, pleae stay tuned and get the latest Brackets build and let us know what you think.
Thanks!
